original: de nyid ngo shes par bya ba'i phyir ni chos rtags kyi phyag rgya rnam pa gsum gyis nyid kyi bstan pa rgyas btab cing 'dar mi rung bar mdzad la /

original: nag por bstan pa dang / chen por bstan pa rnam par dbye ba mdzad pas /
analyzed: nag por bstan pa dang / chen por bstan pa rnam par dbye ba mdzad pas /

original: nyid kyi bstan pa brtag pa rdo ka shi lta bu bzhag par mdzad do //
analyzed: nyid kyi bstan pa brtag pa rdo ka shi lta bu bzhag par mdzad do //

original: de'i phyir deng sang bstan pa la zhugs pa dag gis zhib pa'i blos brtag par bya ba'i rigs kyis ma brtags par gzhan gyi tshig sdig pa can la 'jug par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir deng sang bstan pa la zhugs pa dag gis zhib pa'i blos brtag par bya ba'i rigs kyis ma brtags par gzhan gyi tshig sdig pa can la 'jug par ni mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those who have entered the teaching today should not, without having examined with a subtle mind, engage in the sinful words of others.

original: de ltar na sngar rtog ge bkag pa zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na sngar rtog ge bkag pa zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, In that case, is not logic refuted?

original: 'dir ni gang lung 'bog pa de bla mar rung ba yin nam ma yin pa ni nges par dpyad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir ni gang lung 'bog pa de bla mar rung ba yin nam ma yin pa ni nges par dpyad pa yin la /
translated: Here, it is ascertained whether one who imparts the scriptures is suitable as a guru or not.

original: gang rang bzhin la sogs pa'i kha na mthe ba spang bar ston pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgya gang yang rung bas thebs shing chen po bstan pas @168b khyab na nges par des bstan pa blang ngo //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin la sogs pa'i kha na mthe ba spang bar ston pa la sogs pa'i phyag rgya gang yang rung bas thebs shing chen po bstan pas @168b khyab na nges par des bstan pa blang ngo //
translated: If one is pervaded by the teaching of the great, which is pervaded by any of the seals, such as the teaching of abandoning the faults of nature and so on, then one should definitely take up that teaching.

original: sems kyi bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sems kyi bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: What is called mental concentration is easy to understand.

original: de lta'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob ma dam pa 'ba' zhig gzung ba bstan to //
analyzed: de lta'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob ma dam pa 'ba' zhig gzung ba bstan to //
translated: By thus and so on, it is shown that only a true disciple is taken.

translated: means that, having ascertained that it is so, they became silent, thinking, “We have nothing to dispute with him.”

analyzed: rgyud la gzhan thams cad dad par byed pa'i dgos pa gzigs pas /
translated: Seeing the purpose of causing all others to have faith in the tantra,🔽he spoke deliberately without being asked.🔽This is the deliberate utterance, which is the deliberate utterance of this.

original: ma dris par ched du gsungs pa ni ched du brjod pa 'di'i ched du brjod do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dri ba skabs med par nye bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ma dris par ched du gsungs pa ni ched du brjod pa 'di'i ched du brjod do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dri ba skabs med par nye bar brjod pa'o //
translated: This is the statement without an occasion for another’s question.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: What is it like?🔽The wheel of Yamantaka, etc.

original: gshin rje mthar byed 'khrul 'khor dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rgyud thams cad kyi rtse mo dpal gsang ba 'dus pa yin na /
analyzed: gshin rje mthar byed 'khrul 'khor dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste rgyud thams cad kyi rtse mo dpal gsang ba 'dus pa yin na /
translated: If the glorious Guhyasamaja is the pinnacle of all tantras,

original: der yang rgyud 'dir gsungs pa'i thabs mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: der yang rgyud 'dir gsungs pa'i thabs mi 'byung ste /
translated: the means taught in this tantra do not occur there.

original: de bas na rgyud 'di ni rgyud de'i yang bla ma yin na /
analyzed: de bas na rgyud 'di ni rgyud de'i yang bla ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if this tantra is the guru of that tantra,

analyzed: gzhan rdo rje 'jigs byed la sogs pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: what need is there to mention other tantras such as Vajrabhairava?🔽Now,

original: da ni / ae ma ho //
analyzed: da ni / ae ma ho //
translated: “Amazing!

original: mchog tu mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: mchog tu mya ngan 'das //
translated: Supremely beyond misery.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa byang chub kyi sems ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa byang chub kyi sems ston te /
translated: Thus, it teaches the ultimate thought of enlightenment.

original: dang po ni rigs lnga'i rgyal ba rnams kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni rigs lnga'i rgyal ba rnams kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: The first is spoken by the Victorious Ones of the five families.

original: ae ma ho zhes bya ba ni spro bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma ho zhes bya ba ni spro bar ston pa'o //
translated: Emaho shows enthusiasm.

original: mchog tu mya ngan 'das zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bas mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mchog tu mya ngan 'das zhes bya ba ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa bas mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: Supremely beyond misery means that the non-abiding nirvana is superior to the nirvana of the Sravakas and so forth,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is inexhaustible in the perfect fulfillment of one's own and others' goals.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that non-abiding nirvana?

original: ae ma ho khro bo 'jigs par byed //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ae ma ho khro bo 'jigs par byed // ces gsungs te /
translated: Emaho, the wrathful one who terrifies!

original: dpal gshin rje gshed 'di'i sku nyid snang zhing ma gos pas na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin te de bas na ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: dpal gshin rje gshed 'di'i sku nyid snang zhing ma gos pas na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin te de bas na ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: Since the body of this glorious Yamantaka is visible and unstained, it is the non-abiding nirvana, and therefore it is amazing.

original: de bas na 'khor ba'i thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir rgyun chad pa med cing /
analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba'i thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir rgyun chad pa med cing /
translated: Therefore, because samsara has no beginning or end, it is uninterrupted.

original: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa mdzad pa med pas na ae ma ho 'khor bdag gi rgyun zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa mdzad pa med pas na ae ma ho 'khor bdag gi rgyun zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since the other-dependent and the real do not have action, it is said, “Amazing! The continuum of my samsara.”

original: mngon par byang chub pa de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i ye shes gnas yongs su dag par gyur pa rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i ye shes gnas yongs su dag par gyur pa rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The uninterrupted continuum of the pure abodes of pristine wisdom, such as the observation of suchness of manifest enlightenment, is called “samsara.”

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan @169a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan @169a * //
translated: Samsara and nirvana

original: 'das ; /'di gnyis yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'das ; /'di gnyis yod pa ma yin te //
translated: These two do not exist.

original: 'khor ba yongs su shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su shes pa ni //
translated: Complete knowledge of samsara

original: mya ngan 'das pa zhes bshad do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa zhes bshad do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: Is explained as nirvana.

original: don de'i ngor byas na chos thams cad ni rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin brtsam na /
analyzed: don de'i ngor byas na chos thams cad ni rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin brtsam na /
translated: From the perspective of that meaning, if one analyzes all phenomena in terms of their nature,

original: gdod ma nas mya ngan las 'das pa phra ba yang med pas /
analyzed: gdod ma nas mya ngan las 'das pa phra ba yang med pas /
translated: since even subtle nirvana does not exist from the beginning,

original: ae ma ho chos thams cad gdod ma nas shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa nyid do zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: ae ma ho chos thams cad gdod ma nas shin tu mya ngan las 'das pa nyid do zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Amazing! All phenomena are primordially and totally beyond sorrow.

original: de ltar na chos 'di dag ni rab tu skye zhing 'jig kyang rgyun chad pa yang nam yang med de /
analyzed: de ltar na chos 'di dag ni rab tu skye zhing 'jig kyang rgyun chad pa yang nam yang med de /
translated: Thus, although these phenomena arise and perish, their continuum is never interrupted.

original: brtags zhes bya ba brtags pa tsam //
analyzed: brtags zhes bya ba brtags pa tsam //
translated: What is called imagined is merely imagined.

original: 'khor ba la ni mtha' mi dmigs //
analyzed: 'khor ba la ni mtha' mi dmigs //
translated: The end of cyclic existence is not observed.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yin du zin kyang 'khor bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yin du zin kyang 'khor bar 'gyur la /
translated: Even if it were nirvana, it would be cyclic existence;

original: 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur kyang mya ngan las 'das pa ma btang ba'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba byis pa'i yul ma yin pa'i bden pa gnyis po 'di ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur kyang mya ngan las 'das pa ma btang ba'i phyir phan tshun 'gal ba byis pa'i yul ma yin pa'i bden pa gnyis po 'di ni /
translated: and even if it were the cause of cyclic existence, it would not abandon nirvana. Thus, these two truths, which are not mutually exclusive and are not the domain of the childish, are:

original: ae ma ho shin tu ngo mtshar 'di //
analyzed: ae ma ho shin tu ngo mtshar 'di //
translated: Amazing! How utterly amazing!

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: don 'gal ba 'di mi 'gal bar shes pas ci la phan zhe na /
analyzed: don 'gal ba 'di mi 'gal bar shes pas ci la phan zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of knowing that this contradictory meaning is not contradictory?

original: gang zhig gis she na byis pa dag 'ching ba'i nyes pa'i skyon 'di dag rnal 'byor pa de la yon tan du mi 'gyur ba'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te ji skad du /
analyzed: gang zhig gis she na byis pa dag 'ching ba'i nyes pa'i skyon 'di dag rnal 'byor pa de la yon tan du mi 'gyur ba'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te ji skad du /
translated: What is it that binds the childish? These faults of the faults of error do not become qualities for the yogi.🔽The sutra continues:

original: chos gang gis ni byis pa dag /'khor ba'i gnas su 'ching 'gyur ba /
analyzed: chos gang gis ni byis pa dag /'khor ba'i gnas su 'ching 'gyur ba /
translated: Any phenomenon by which the childish are bound in the place of cyclic existence,

original: chos de nyid kyis rnal 'byor pa /
analyzed: chos de nyid kyis rnal 'byor pa /
translated: by that very phenomenon the yogi

original: 'khor ba'i mthar ni 'gro ba yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i mthar ni 'gro ba yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: goes to the end of cyclic existence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gis 'ching ba'i chos de ni 'ga' yang ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis 'ching ba'i chos de ni 'ga' yang ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the phenomenon by which one is bound is not seen at all.🔽It is said:

original: dngos min dngos po med pa min //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos min dngos po med pa min // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is not a thing, nor is it a non-thing.

original: 'di dag rigs pas bltas na gnas pa'i mthu med pas na dngos po med min te /
analyzed: 'di dag rigs pas bltas na gnas pa'i mthu med pas na dngos po med min te /
translated: When these are seen with reasoning, they have no power to endure, and so they are not things.

original: 'on kyang chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis mngon sum kho nar gsal bar snang bas na /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos rnams kyi chos nyid kyis mngon sum kho nar gsal bar snang bas na /
translated: However, because they appear clearly and directly by the reality of phenomena,🔽they are not non-things.

original: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin te de ltar na rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' las rgal ba sgyu ma tsam du gnas te de shes pa la ni gnod pa gang yang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'ang ma yin te de ltar na rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' las rgal ba sgyu ma tsam du gnas te de shes pa la ni gnod pa gang yang mi 'byung ste /
translated: Nor is it nonexistent, for in that case it would be beyond the extremes of eternalism and nihilism, and it would be merely an illusion.

original: de ni nyes pa'i tshogs kyi gnyen po yin pas na /🔽chos la bdag med mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa'i tshogs kyi gnyen po yin pas na / chos la bdag med mkhas pa ni //
translated: There is no fault in knowing it, for it is the antidote to the mass of faults.🔽The wise who know the selflessness of phenomena

original: rang bzhin med pa gom byas pas //🔽phyin ci log las byung ba yi //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa gom byas pas // phyin ci log las byung ba yi //
translated: are skilled in the absence of nature.

original: nyon mongs sgrib pa med par spong //
analyzed: nyon mongs sgrib pa med par spong //
translated: They abandon the afflictive obstructions

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: that arise from error.

original: rang bzhin phra rab rtogs pa de yang med de /
analyzed: rang bzhin phra rab rtogs pa de yang med de /
translated: That subtle nature is also not realized, for🔽it is not an element,

original: khams min zhes bya ba mig la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: khams min zhes bya ba mig la sogs pa'am /
translated: and it is not time,

analyzed: dus ni gnyid log sad par byed // ces bya ba @169b la sogs pas dus la sogs pa'i khams 'dod pa yang /

analyzed: kun du rtog pa tsam snying por gyur gyi rang bzhin med do //
translated: Thus, the elements asserted by the Vaibhāṣikas, such as time, are also merely the essence of imagination; they have no nature.

original: bye brag tu smra bas bzhag pa bstan du med pa'i rdzas rab tu dge ba yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas bzhag pa bstan du med pa'i rdzas rab tu dge ba yang mi 'thad de /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas also assert a substantially real unobservable that is extremely virtuous. That is untenable.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa'i nang du gsal bas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa la sogs pa'i nang du gsal bas na /
translated: Since it is clear in the noble Descent into Laṅkā and so forth,

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'das pa min //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'das pa min //

translated: Since it is naturally luminous, it is like space.  Since the self of subject and object does not exist at all in the perfect pristine wisdom, there is no harm to this.

analyzed: de nyid ni /
translated: This is also

analyzed: zhes gsungs te ji skad du bde ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: skye ba 'di ni rab tu gnas // zhes gsungs te /

translated: Moreover, he is the lord of secrets because he was empowered to hold the meaning of the secrets of all the Tathagatas.

analyzed: de nyid mthu'i khyad par rab tu phye bas na chen po'o //

analyzed: rdo rje'i mtshan ma las byung bas na rdo rje'i rigs so //
translated: He is the Vajra Family because he arose from the sign of the vajra.

analyzed: yang na gnod sbyin lag na rdo rje dag gi rigs su skyes pas na rdo rje'i rigs @172a * //
translated: Or, he is the Vajra Family because he was born into the family of the yakshas who hold the vajra.

analyzed: so ; / sngar bstan pa'i yon tan dang bcas pas na khyad par can no //
translated: He is distinguished because he possesses the qualities taught above.

original: des na de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: des na de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he is called that.

original: de ci'i phyir gsungs she na /

original: na ta ku be ra zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: na ta ku be ra zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The words nata kubera are mentioned.

analyzed: 'di dag ni lha mo'i bud med kyi sgyu ma rab tu mang po dang / rab tu 'jigs su rung ba'i gar byed pas na gar mkhan na ta ste bdud kyi sde'o //
translated: These are the dancers who are the hosts of Mara, because they are the many, very frightening, illusory women of the goddess who dance.

original: des ni 'gro ba ma lus pa lam las bzlog cing chud gson pas na dan pa ste ku'o //
analyzed: des ni 'gro ba ma lus pa lam las bzlog cing chud gson pas na dan pa ste ku'o //
translated: Since they turn all beings away from the path and cause them to perish, they are danta, which is ku.

original: bdud kyi las ni dan pa yin pas so //
analyzed: bdud kyi las ni dan pa yin pas so //
translated: Because the activity of Mara is danta.

original: de bzlog pa'i phyir na be ra ste de skad ces gsungs so zhes sbyar ro //🔽bdud kyi sde log pa nyid ci la dgongs she na /
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i phyir na be ra ste de skad ces gsungs so zhes sbyar ro // bdud kyi sde log pa nyid ci la dgongs she na /
translated: In order to avert that, there is vera, which is said in that way.

original: brgya byin log par rnam par snang byed du gyur pa'i las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za bar bstan pa dang dgos pa bcu'i ched du ste de ni ji skad du 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: brgya byin log par rnam par snang byed du gyur pa'i las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za bar bstan pa dang dgos pa bcu'i ched du ste de ni ji skad du 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u las /
translated: If it is asked what is the purpose of the reversal of the hosts of Mara, it is for ten purposes, such as demonstrating that the result of the karma of Indra becoming Mara does not perish. As it says in the chapter of the transcendent world:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras don rnam pa bcu po 'di dag gi dbang yang dag par mthong nas snying po byang chub mchog la 'dug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras don rnam pa bcu po 'di dag gi dbang yang dag par mthong nas snying po byang chub mchog la 'dug pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston te /
translated: O son of the victors, having seen the power of these ten points, the bodhisattva who is seated on the site of enlightenment demonstrates the subjugation of Mara.

original: bcu gang zhe na 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa na /
translated: What are the ten? In this way, in the infinite world systems that are afflicted,

original: 'thab mo dang g-yul la sogs pa mos pa'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: 'thab mo dang g-yul la sogs pa mos pa'i sems can rnams la /
translated: for the sake of sentient beings who are intent on fighting, battle, and so forth,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi che ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi che ba nyid yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston to //
translated: the bodhisattva demonstrates the subjugation of Mara in order to reveal the greatness of the bodhisattva's power.

analyzed: yid gnyis dang the tshom du gyur pa'i mi dang / lha rnams kyi yid gnyis dang the tshom gcod pa'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
translated: In order to cut through the doubts and uncertainties of humans and gods, he demonstrates the subjugation of Mara.

original: bdud kyi sde yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
analyzed: bdud kyi sde yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
translated: In order to bring Mara's faction to full maturity, he demonstrates the subjugation of Mara.

original: 'thab mo dang g-yul la mos pa'i mi dang / lha rnams kun nas bsdu ba dang / kun nas 'dus pa'i lha dang / mi rnams 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
analyzed: 'thab mo dang g-yul la mos pa'i mi dang / lha rnams kun nas bsdu ba dang / kun nas 'dus pa'i lha dang / mi rnams 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
translated: He manifests the subjugation of Mara in order to gather together all the gods and all the assembled gods and men, and in order to convert men.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu la thub pa med par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mthu la thub pa med par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
translated: He manifests the subjugation of Mara in order to demonstrate the invincible power of the bodhisattva.

original: sems can gzhan mos shing spro bar bya ba'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
analyzed: sems can gzhan mos shing spro bar bya ba'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
translated: He manifests the subjugation of Mara in order to inspire confidence in other beings.

original: phyi ma'i skye bo rnams la snying brtse ba'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
analyzed: phyi ma'i skye bo rnams la snying brtse ba'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
translated: He manifests the subjugation of Mara out of compassion for future generations.

analyzed: snying po byang chub kyi bar gyi bdud kyi las yongs su bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi la ma thams cad las 'das par yongs @172b su bstan pa'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
translated: He manifests the subjugation of Mara in order to demonstrate the activities of Mara up to the site of enlightenment and in order to demonstrate the bodhisattvas transcendence of all the activities of Mara.

original: nyon mongs pa'i stobs kyi nyams smad cing stobs med par byas pa yongs su bstan pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba brjod pa dang / byams pa'i stobs yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i stobs kyi nyams smad cing stobs med par byas pa yongs su bstan pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba brjod pa dang / byams pa'i stobs yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir bdud 'dul ba ston to //
translated: He shows the subjugation of Mara in order to show that he has humbled and weakened the power of the afflictions, in order to proclaim the roots of virtue, and in order to show the power of love.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa dag tu chos nyid rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa dag tu chos nyid rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston to //
translated: The bodhisattva shows the subjugation of Mara in order to follow the Dharma in the infinite world systems that are afflicted.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras don bcu po de dag gi dbang mthong bas na byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston to zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras don bcu po de dag gi dbang mthong bas na byang chub sems dpa' bdud 'dul ba ston to zhes gsungs so //
translated: O Son of the Victorious Ones, seeing the power of these ten points, the bodhisattva shows the subjugation of Mara.

analyzed: gzhan dag 'di 'gro ba chags par byed pa'i gar gyi nyams dgu'o //

translated: Therefore, in this tantra as well, in order to show the ten powers of the meaning and to demonstrate the power of mantra, he displays the unequaled subjugation of Mara, and teaches that Those who will appear in the world should attain this state.
